results.title: G20’s Closing Statements On Cryptocurrency And Blockchain
results.summary: The G20 summit in Argentina closed its session with a directive for future development of crypto-asset and blockchain standards, protections, and innovation.

results.title: US Treasury Could Add Cryptocurrency Wallet Addresses To Sanctions List
results.summary: The Treasury has laid the groundwork to add specific wallet addresses to its SDN List, but the efficacy of the department’s approach is questionable.

results.title: Did Russia Help Create The Venezuelan Petro To Undermine US Sanctions?
results.summary: Russian officials and businessmen were reportedly instrumental in helping Venezuela create its oil-backed petro cryptocurrency. If true, the interference was likely intended to erode US sanctions that have afflicted Russia since 2014.

results.title: Edward Snowden Reveals Bitcoin Inquiries By NSA
results.summary: The NSA has been snooping around the bitcoin blockchain – and maybe a little more.

results.title: France’s Le Maire Places Cryptocurrency Regulation ‘At Heart’ Of G20 Discussions
results.summary: France’s minister of finance published an op-ed today, highlighting France’s crypto-related ambitions. He used very enthusiastic language and likely timed the publication to coincide with today’s G20 meeting of central bankers.

results.title: FTC Creates Blockchain Working Group
results.summary: On Friday, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) established a blockchain working group, which will facilitate external coordination on enforcement actions among other responsibilities.

results.title: G20 Summit Attendees Largely Agree That Cryptocurrencies Are Assets
results.summary: Financial authorities currently attending the 2018 G20 Buenos Aires summit are reportedly nearing a consensus on the position that cryptocurrencies are assets.

results.title: Coca-Cola, US State Department Consider Blockchain For Labor Registry
results.summary: On Friday, at SXSW, Coca-Cola shared that the company will collaborate with the US State Department, Blockchain Trust Accelerator, and Bitfury to create a blockchain pilot to clamp down on forced labor and exploitation.

results.title: Incoming PBoC Governor Has Spoken Positively On Bitcoin
results.summary: The People’s Bank of China has a new governor, Yi Gang. In the past, Yi has used positive terms to describe bitcoin.

results.title: FSB Chairman To G20 Summit In Argentina: ‘Crypto-Assets Do Not Pose Risks’
results.summary: The central bankers and finance ministers of G20 member nations are meeting today and tomorrow in Buenos Aries to discuss the future of the global economy. Talks will include cryptocurrency and associated regulations.

results.title: Trump Bans Venezuelan Petro Cryptocurrency
results.summary: On Monday, President Trump signed an executive order prohibiting American usage of or investment in the petro.

results.title: Japan’s FSA Hosted Blockchain Roundtable For Central Banks, Regulators
results.summary: Japan’s Financial Services Agency has hosted a closed-door meeting between financial authorities and blockchain stakeholders from around the globe. Attendees discussed issues relating to security, consumer protection, and more.

results.title: Twitter Will Ban Advertisements For ICOs, Cryptocurrency Wallets
results.summary: According to reports, Twitter will soon revise its policies to prohibit advertisements for cryptocurrency wallet providers and initial coin offerings (ICOs).

results.title: Thought Leaders Advocate For Pan-Europe Public Blockchain
results.summary: While individual blockchain endeavors have spun up from Lithuania to Switzerland, there is an effort to create a far-reaching blockchain that will span Europe.

results.title: [UPDATED] Electricity Tariff For Some Cryptocurrency Miners Approved In New York
results.summary: Municipal power authorities in upstate New York have received permission to charge certain cryptocurrency mining enterprises higher rates for the use of their electricity than they charge other customers.

results.title: Initial Coin Offerings Must Learn From Theranos
results.summary: “Innovators who seek to revolutionize and disrupt an industry must tell investors the truth about what their technology can do today, not just what they hope it might do someday.”

results.title: Royal Bank Of Canada Patent Application Describes Automated Credit Score Platform Using Blockchain Technology
results.summary: A Royal bank Of Canada patent application released yesterday depicts a blockchain platform that records credit records and uses historical and predictive data to compute credit ratings.

results.title: Blockchain And Cryptocurrencies Highlighted In 2018 Congressional Economic Report
results.summary: The United States Congress Joint Economic Committee has released its annual economic report which – for the first time – contains significant mention of cryptocurrency as well as related trends and technology.

results.title: US District Court And FTC Move Against Cryptocurrency Schemes
results.summary: The Federal Trade Commission announced today that four individuals have had their assets frozen by a US Federal District Court for allegedly promoting cryptocurrency schemes promising large returns for small cryptocurrency payments.

results.title: Gov't-Affiliated Investment Association In China To Launch Blockchain ‘Center’
results.summary: A government-affiliated organization in China has announced that, in line with the country’s current “five-year plan” for economic growth, it will establish an organization to promote blockchain investment and development.
tags: International Blockchain Investment and Development Center

results.title: Big-Time Bitcoin Investor, Peter Thiel, Skeptical About Most Other Cryptocurrencies
results.summary: “I would be long bitcoin, and neutral to skeptical of just about everything else at this point.”

results.title: Staying The Ethereum Course
results.summary: A recent surge of negative blockchain publicity has coincided with a plunge in cryptocurrency’s total market capitalization, after having surpassed $800 billion in the first week of 2018. Is blockchain technology truly overhyped or is Ethereum on the path to busting the decentralized floodgates of mass adoption wide open?

results.title: Zurich: Blockchain Leadership Summit Features Growing International Government Interest
results.summary: President Putin’s economic adviser and Prince Michael of Liechtenstein both stood out among a wide-ranging host of blockchain thought leaders and industry experts who discussed possible future initiatives to an international audience.

results.title: Korean Authorities Raid Three Cryptocurrency Exchanges
results.summary: Korean officials have visited the premises of three digital asset exchanges where staff are suspected of illegally taking possession of customer funds in order to buy virtual currency for themselves.

results.title: Lightning Labs’ Beta Goes Live On Bitcoin Mainnet
results.summary: A beta version of a lightning network implementation has gone live on the Bitcoin mainnet in what Lightning Labs CEO Elizabeth Stark calls a first.
